text: <@U03FJQPSC0Y> I got to this page via the "CRM Development" tab in the main nav. I am a Super Admin, but I'm trying to give access to this section to an engineer who is not a Super Admin.
I personally have access to everything in that section, but our engineer does not :disappointed:
For the timebeing only superadmins have access to it, but I understand itâ€™s not ideal and we are looking into it.
Got it. Hm. I'll have to think about the best way to give our engineer access.

We're going to install HubSpot analytics/tracking in our web app. However, there's a piece of important information I can't find. All of the other platforms we've evaluated (HotJar, Heap, Pendo) have a method of redacting/ignoring/suppressing events on specific elements that will contain private information that we can't have tracked (medical patients' names, for example). In those instances we're either adding a `class` name or a custom `data-` attribute. Is there something similar in HubSpot?
